column5: NEW YORK  Nov 24 U.S. stock index futures pointed to a higher open on Monday  indicating that major indexes would move further into record territory on the back of multiple merger deals and hopes that China will take further accommodative monetary policy action.

column4: UPDATE 1-Mexico's IEnova wins CFE gas pipeline project near U.S. border
column5: MEXICO CITY  Nov 24 A unit of energy infrastructure company IEnova  the Mexican subsidiary of U.S. firm Sempra Energy  said on Monday that Mexico's state power company CFE had awarded it a 25-year contract to build and operate a natural gas pipeline in the north of the country.

column4: Stryker weighing bid for Smith & Nephew: Bloomberg
column5: LONDON U.S. medical device maker Stryker Corp  is examining a bid for Britain's Smith & Nephew Plc  as a regulatory restriction barring an offer comes to an end  Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing unnamed sources.

column4: Chip equipment maker ASML sells first next-generation EUV systems
column5: AMSTERDAM  Nov 24 Dutch semiconductor equipment maker ASML has received its first order for next-generation extreme ultraviolet (EUV) chip etching systems in a deal with Taiwan's TSMC.

column4: BT lines up O2 and EE in quest for British telecoms supremacy
column5: LONDON/MADRID Britain's BT Group  has been approached by O2 owner Telefonica  and the parents of O2's bigger rival EE to discuss competing multibillion-pound deals to create a powerhouse in fixed-line broadband  mobile and TV.

column4: UPDATE 3-BT lines up O2 and EE in quest for British telecoms supremacy
column5: LONDON/MADRID Nov 24 Britain's BT Group  has been approached by O2 owner Telefonica and the parents of O2's bigger rival EE to discuss competing multibillion-pound deals to create a powerhouse in fixed-line broadband  mobile and TV.

column4: BT in talks to buy UK mobile operator
column5: LONDON/MADRID Britain's BT Group is in early stage talks with Spain's Telefonica on a deal to buy UK mobile operator O2  with two sources saying it has also begun negotiations with EE as it seeks a return to the British consumer mobile market.

column4: Spain's Telefonica in preliminary talks with BT over UK operations
column5: MADRID  Nov 24 Spanish telecoms group Telefonica  said on Monday it was in preliminary talks with BT  over a potential transaction involving its UK unit.

column4: BT confirms talks with Telefonica's O2  other UK network
column5: LONDON  Nov 24 Britain's BT said on Monday it had been approached by shareholders in Telefonica   owner of O2  and another UK network operator about BT buying their British businesses.

column4: BRIEF-BT in talks with Telefonica's O2  other UK network
column5: * Notes recent press speculation relating to a potential transaction involving Telefónica UK (O2) in UK.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telefonica in talks to sell O2 to BT -Spanish news website
column5: MADRID/LONDON  Nov 24 Spain's Telefonica  could sell its UK mobile operator O2 to British Telecom  in return for a 20 percent stake in BT as part of a "strategic alliance" to strengthen the pair  Spanish website El Confidencial reported on Monday.

column4: Telefonica in talks to sell O2 to BT - report

column4: New UTC chief known to Wall Street  giving solace amid abrupt move
column5: Nov 24 United Technologies Corp's  appointment of Chief Financial Officer Gregory Hayes as chief executive is providing investors some comfort as they try to understand the abrupt departure of previous leader Louis Chenevert.

column4: United Tech CEO steps down  replaced by CFO in abrupt change
column5: United Technologies Corp  Chief Executive Officer Louis Chenevert has retired immediately and is being replaced by the company's finance chief  the diversified U.S. manufacturer said on Monday  an abrupt change that caught Wall Street off guard.

column5: Nov 24 United Technologies Corp  the maker of elevators and air conditioners  said Chairman and Chief Executive Louis Chenevert would retire immediately.

column4: Fitch Rates Verizon's Sr. Unsecured Notes 'A-'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  November 24 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'A-' rating to  Verizon Communications Inc.'s (NYSE: -VZ) offering of EUR1.4 billion of 1.625%  senior unsecured notes due 2024 and EUR1 billion of 2.625% senior unsecured  notes due 2031. VZ plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes   which may include the acquisition of spectrum licenses  and if market and other  conditions permit  the repayment of debt. Fitch c

column4: Visteon eyes $3.6 billion sale of South Korean unit: reports
column5: SEOUL U.S. automotive parts maker Visteon Corp  has signed a preliminary deal to sell its controlling stake in South Korea's Halla Visteon Climate Control Corp  to a local private equity firm for $3.6 billion  Korean media reports said.

column4: Visteon agrees to sell stake in S.Korean unit -reports
column5: SEOUL  Nov 24 U.S. automotive parts maker Visteon Corp has signed a preliminary deal to sell all of its stake in South Korean unit Halla Visteon Climate Control Corp  according to reports in local media  sending Halla Visteon shares sliding to their lowest levels in over six months.

column4: Bayer explores possible sale of diabetes device unit -Bloomberg
column5: Nov 24 Germany-based drugmaker Bayer AG  is considering the sale of its diabetes device business  Bloomberg reported  citing sources.
